item.title: UFO sightings in Belgium
item.description:
UFO Sightings in Belgium ðŸ”—

This article documents alleged UFO sightings in Belgium, focusing primarily on the significant wave of sightings between 1989 and 1990.

1989-1990 ðŸ”—

This section highlights the Belgian UFO wave, a period of intense UFO activity. The main feature of this wave was the frequent reports of triangular UFOs observed across the country. These objects were even pursued by Belgian Air Force F-16 fighter jets, and some photographs were taken. One speculative explanation suggested these sightings might have been misidentified stealth aircraft, specifically the F-117 Nighthawk, using Belgian highways for navigation.

1990-03-30 ðŸ”—

This section details a specific mass sighting event that occurred on March 30, 1990, in Ans, Wallonia. Numerous witnesses reported seeing large, silent, low-flying black triangles. These objects were tracked by multiple NATO radar systems and intercepted by jet fighters. The Belgian military investigated the incident, and photographic evidence is said to exist. A close encounter was also reported during this event.

This section contains a template linking to various UFO-related topics on Wikipedia. It includes links to:

  • Claimed Sightings:
    • A general list of reported UFO sightings.
    • Sightings in outer space and near atomic sites.
    • Sightings from pre-20th century to the 21st century, including notable events like the Roswell incident, the Phoenix Lights, and the USS Nimitz UFO incident.
    • Confirmed hoaxes like the Maury Island hoax and the Alien Autopsy film.
    • Sightings by country, including Africa, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, China, France, Mexico, Russia, Spain, the United Kingdom, and the United States.
  • Types of UFOs: Black triangles, flying saucers, foo fighters, ghost rockets, green fireballs, mystery airships, and space jellyfish.
  • Types of Alleged Extraterrestrial Beings: Energy beings, grey aliens, insectoids, little green men, Nordic aliens, and reptilian humanoids.
  • Studies and Timeline: Projects and reports like Project Sign, Project Blue Book, the Condon Report, and the Advanced Aerospace Threat Identification Program.
  • Hypotheses: Ancient astronauts, extraterrestrial, interdimensional, psychological, and psychosocial hypotheses.
  • Conspiracy Theories: Area 51, Bob Lazar, Dulce Base, and Men in Black.
  • Involvement:
    • Abduction claims, including history, entities, narrative, and perspectives.
    • Other aspects like implants, cattle mutilation, close encounters, contactees, crop circles, government responses, and ufologists.
  • Culture: UFOs in fiction and religions.
  • Skepticism: Links to scientific skeptics and the Committee for Skeptical Inquiry.
  • Government & Law: Mentions United States Congress hearings on UFOs and the Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena Disclosure Act (UADPA).
